column1: Lossarnach was a region and fiefdom in southern Gondor.

column2: it was a fertile region lying south of eastern end of the White Mountains. It was the region closest to Minas Tirith
column3: which depended on the fruit cultivated in the orchards of Lossarnach. Residents of Minas Tirith were also known to make expeditions to the region to behold its renowned flowers and trees (which surely included the valley Imloth Melui).

column1: At the end of the Third Age
column2: its lord was the old Forlong the Fat
column3: who led two hundred men to the aid of Minas Tirith. Forlong was killed in the Battle of the Pelennor Fields
column4: but many of his men survived and accompanied Aragorn Elessar on his way to the Black Gate
column5: even though most of them were farmers.

column1: Lossarnach was populated by many refugees from Ithilien and Osgiliath. During the War of the Ring
column2: most women and children from Minas Tirith were sent there.

column1: Famous people from the region included the wise-woman Ioreth who served in the Houses of Healing of Minas Tirith
